item.title: How Two Georgia Tech Students Came Up With The Common App For Internships
item.description: April 4, 2017 - Students create their profile and can apply for several internships with one click. Currently, InternBlitz is available to students at Georgia Tech, but there are plans to add more campuses soon.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 4, 2017 - Students create their profile and can apply for several internships with one click. Currently, InternBlitz is available to students at Georgia Tech, but there are plans to add more campuses soon. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/04/04/522038496/how-two-georgia-tech-students-came-up-with-the-common-app-for-internships

item.title: How Russian Twitter Bots Pumped Out Fake News During The 2016 Election
item.description: April 3, 2017 - Clint Watts, a former FBI agent, describes a diffuse network of Russian hackers and propagandists conducting a misinformation campaign that didn't stop with the election of President Trump.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 3, 2017 - Clint Watts, a former FBI agent, describes a diffuse network of Russian hackers and propagandists conducting a misinformation campaign that didn't stop with the election of President Trump. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/04/03/522503844/how-russian-twitter-bots-pumped-out-fake-news-during-the-2016-election

item.title: Pittsburgh Offers Driving Lessons For Uber's Autonomous Cars
item.description: April 3, 2017 - Uber has been testing driverless cars in the city for the past six months. Local officials are happy for the investment the experiment brings and for the boost to the city's reputation as a tech hub.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 3, 2017 - Uber has been testing driverless cars in the city for the past six months. Local officials are happy for the investment the experiment brings and for the boost to the city's reputation as a tech hub. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/04/03/522099560/pittsburgh-offers-driving-lessons-for-ubers-autonomous-cars

item.title: Self-Driving Cars Raise Questions About Who Carries Insurance
item.description: April 3, 2017 - Currently, insurance rates are calculated based on drivers' claims histories and driving records. Driverless cars are expected to shift the liability toward carmakers. But it won't happen all at once.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 3, 2017 - Currently, insurance rates are calculated based on drivers' claims histories and driving records. Driverless cars are expected to shift the liability toward carmakers. But it won't happen all at once. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/04/03/522222975/self-driving-cars-raise-questions-about-who-carries-insurance

item.title: Solar Power Advocates Undeterred By Trump's Climate Policies
item.description: April 2, 2017 - Some worry that President Trump's rollback in climate policy will hurt renewable energy. But in Arizona, a state that has embraced solar energy, those in the industry say the outlook is still bright.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 2, 2017 - Some worry that President Trump's rollback in climate policy will hurt renewable energy. But in Arizona, a state that has embraced solar energy, those in the industry say the outlook is still bright. http://www.npr.org/2017/04/02/522357476/solar-power-advocates-undeterred-by-trumps-climate-policies

item.title: Actors Give Voice To Trump's Tweets
item.description: April 2, 2017 - As long as there have been national leaders, there have been court jesters. Whether skewering the boss on stage, on TV or now, on Twitter, it's a tradition satirists take seriously.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 2, 2017 - As long as there have been national leaders, there have been court jesters. Whether skewering the boss on stage, on TV or now, on Twitter, it's a tradition satirists take seriously. http://www.npr.org/2017/04/02/522357462/actors-give-voice-to-trumps-tweets

item.title: Meet 2 Race Sleuths Trying to Keep Marathoners Honest
item.description: April 2, 2017 - Spring is a busy season for runners — and for the sleuths sniffing out race cheats. With an eye on the Boston Marathon, amateur investigators use math and methodology to protect the sport's integrity.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 2, 2017 - Spring is a busy season for runners — and for the sleuths sniffing out race cheats. With an eye on the Boston Marathon, amateur investigators use math and methodology to protect the sport's integrity. http://www.npr.org/2017/04/02/518811503/meet-two-race-sleuths-trying-to-keep-marathoners-honest

item.title: From Wristwatches To Radio, How World War I Ushered In The Modern World
item.description: April 2, 2017 - The war is remembered for trench warfare, millions of deaths and the failure to bring lasting peace. But it also brought together emerging technologies, remaking life on and off the battlefield.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 2, 2017 - The war is remembered for trench warfare, millions of deaths and the failure to bring lasting peace. But it also brought together emerging technologies, remaking life on and off the battlefield. http://www.npr.org/sections/parallels/2017/04/02/521792062/from-wristwatches-to-radio-how-world-war-i-ushered-in-the-modern-world

item.title: Twitter Drops Its Egg, The Unintended Avatar Of Harassment
item.description: March 31, 2017 - Twitter announced it was doing away with the egg as its default icon, opting for a generic figure intended to encourage users to replace it with something more "expressive."
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 31, 2017 - Twitter announced it was doing away with the egg as its default icon, opting for a generic figure intended to encourage users to replace it with something more "expressive." http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/03/31/522229420/twitter-drops-its-egg-the-unintended-avatar-of-harassment

item.title: Will Using Artificial Intelligence To Make Loans Trade One Kind Of Bias For Another?
item.description: March 31, 2017 - The next loan you get may depend less on your credit score and more on what a program thinks of your habits. Digital lenders say the process will be more fair, but others worry about unintended bias.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 31, 2017 - The next loan you get may depend less on your credit score and more on what a program thinks of your habits. Digital lenders say the process will be more fair, but others worry about unintended bias. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/03/31/521946210/will-using-artificial-intelligence-to-make-loans-trade-one-kind-of-bias-for-anot

item.title: How Can You Bring Innovation To Government Services? Follow Users
item.description: March 30, 2017 - NPR's Ari Shapiro talks with Jennifer Pahlka, founder and executive director of Code for America, about what it takes to bring innovation to government.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 30, 2017 - NPR's Ari Shapiro talks with Jennifer Pahlka, founder and executive director of Code for America, about what it takes to bring innovation to government. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/03/30/522091613/how-can-you-bring-innovation-to-government-services-follow-users

item.title: Congress Votes To Roll Back FCC's Internet Privacy Protections
item.description: March 29, 2017 - Congress approved a measure that rolls back an FCC rule that would have required Internet providers to ask permission before selling consumers' personal data.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 29, 2017 - Congress approved a measure that rolls back an FCC rule that would have required Internet providers to ask permission before selling consumers' personal data. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/29/521954026/congress-votes-to-roll-back-fccs-internet-privacy-protections

item.title: The U.S. Has An 'Active Cyber War Underway' To Thwart The North Korean Nuclear Threat
item.description: March 29, 2017 - New York Times reporter David Sanger talks about North Korea's nuclear program and warns that the regime, which has been "fodder for late night comedians for many many years," is no joke.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)

item.title: Where Have All The Bob Seger Albums Gone?
item.description: March 29, 2017 - In the era of streaming music, everything ever recorded is supposed to be at our fingertips. So how did one of the biggest names in the Classic Rock canon go missing?
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 29, 2017 - In the era of streaming music, everything ever recorded is supposed to be at our fingertips. So how did one of the biggest names in the Classic Rock canon go missing? http://www.npr.org/sections/therecord/2017/03/29/521642313/where-have-all-the-bob-seger-albums-gone

item.title: Run-Up To Census 2020 Raises Concerns Over Security And Politics
item.description: March 28, 2017 - Results from the U.S. Census in 2020 could remake the political map. Some census experts say the stakes for the upcoming national headcount are higher than normal.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 28, 2017 - Results from the U.S. Census in 2020 could remake the political map. Some census experts say the stakes for the upcoming national headcount are higher than normal. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/03/28/521789446/run-up-to-census-2020-raises-concerns-over-security-and-politics
